member.name: T:SLAMBotClasses.ArduinoSlam
member.summary: This class allow you to communicate with the Arduino micro-controller (the blue microchip) this will let you control all the electronics on the robot.

member.name: M:SLAMBotClasses.ArduinoSlam.Connect
member.summary: This will connect your computer to the arduino micro-controller which will allow the two to communicate. This will scan all the COM ports on your computer and automatically find the Arduino. This method is asynchronous so you can call it and wait for the OnStatusChanged event to tell you it's connected.

member.name: M:SLAMBotClasses.ArduinoSlam.CloseConnection
member.summary: If you are connected to the Arduino this will close the connection. You should do this before exiting the program but it's not a big deal if you don't.

member.name: M:SLAMBotClasses.ArduinoSlam.TurnTestLightOff
member.summary: There is a very small LED on the arduino near pin 13, this turns it off.

member.name: M:SLAMBotClasses.ArduinoSlam.TurnTestLightOn
member.summary: There is a very small LED on the arduino near pin 13, this turns it on.

member.name: M:SLAMBotClasses.ArduinoSlam.SendGForceAndTemp(System.Boolean)
member.summary: This will tell the arduino that you want to have it start or stop sending you information about the accelerometer and temperature sensor. This information will be sent to you through the OnSensorInfoReady event and will fire about every 200 milliseconds.
